name: publishbcappdocker
friendlyName: Business Central - Publish App to Container
description: Publish App to Dynamics 365 Business Central container
helpMarkDown: Will take all the apps in folder and try to publish them to the container
author: Kine

inputs.name: HostName
inputs.label: Container Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the host for the container (if not local for the agent)

inputs.name: ContainerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container to publish the app to

inputs.name: SourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder with the apps to install.

inputs.name: Scope
inputs.label: Scope
inputs.helpMarkDown: Scope to publish the app too.

inputs.name: SkipVerify
inputs.label: Skip Verify
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set if app is not signed and you want to skip signature verification

inputs.name: UseDevEndpoint
inputs.label: Use Dev Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, publishing will use dev endpoint to do the job, like when publishing from VS Code.

inputs.name: AppDownloadScript
inputs.label: Missing app download script
inputs.helpMarkDown: This script will be used to download missing dependencies. Use parameters name, publisher, version and path inside the script.

inputs.name: UsePaket
inputs.label: Use Paket for downloading nuget dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use Paket manager to download the nuget dependencies

inputs.name: IncludeAppFiles
inputs.label: Include App files into dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, dependencies from app files will be installed automatically even when app.json files exists
